title: Tutsi
summary: The Tutsi (/ˈtʊtsi/;[2] Kinyarwanda pronunciation: [ɑ.βɑ.tuː.t͡si]), or Abatutsi, are an ethnic group of the African Great Lakes region. Tutsi are a Bantu-speaking[3] ethnic group of probable Nilotic origin,[4] and the second largest of three main ethnic groups in Rwanda and Burundi (the other two being the largest Bantu ethnic group Hutu and the Pygmy group of the Twa).[5]
